info.title: Cloudsmith API
info.description: The API to the Cloudsmith Service

get.description: Returns individual log-level records of client downloads, including bandwidth in bytes. Available for _Manager_ or _Owner_ level users only. All times in UTC.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: End of the time range to filter logs. End time is exclusive, i.e. an end time of `2025-01-01` results in a query that returns logs with a timestamp of _before_ `2025-01-01T00:00:00`.

parameters.name: entitlement_token
parameters.description: Unique identifier to grant access to a specific software package or repository. Accepted values are the token name, token unique identifier or the token itself.

parameters.name: http_status
parameters.description: HTTP status code by which to filter logs.

parameters.name: ip_address
parameters.description: IP address or CIDR range with which to filter logs. Supports IPv4 and IPv6.

parameters.name: package
parameters.description: Package slug or unique identifier by which to filter logs.

parameters.name: package_format

items.description:
* `DEB` - Debian
* `RPM` - RedHat
* `RUBY` - Ruby
* `PYTHON` - Python
* `MAVEN` - Maven
* `BOWER` - Bower
* `DOCKER` - Docker
* `RAW` - Raw
* `CHOCOLATEY` - Chocolatey
* `NPM` - npm
* `NUGET` - NuGet
* `VAGRANT` - Vagrant
* `COMPOSER` - Composer
* `ALPINE` - Alpine
* `HELM` - Helm
* `CONAN` - Conan
* `CARGO` - Cargo
* `LUAROCKS` - LuaRocks
* `CRAN` - CRAN
* `GO` - Go
* `DART` - Dart
* `COCOAPODS` - CocoaPods
* `TERRAFORM` - Terraform
* `P2` - P2
* `CONDA` - Conda
* `HEX` - Hex
* `SWIFT` - Swift
* `DEFAULT` - Default

parameters.description: Type of package formats by which to filter logs (e.g. Nuget, Cargo, Raw). Multiple formats can be provided e.g. `package_format=Nuget&package_format=Cargo`.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: List of repositories for filtering logs. Multiple repositories can be provided e.g. `repository=test-repo&repository=another-repo`.

parameters.name: repository_type
parameters.description: The type of repository - `Public`, `Private` or `Open Source`.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Start of the time range to filter logs. Start time is inclusive, i.e. a Start time of `2025-01-01` results in a query that returns logs with a timestamp starting from `2025-01-01T00:00:00`.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User email or user unique identifier for filtering logs. Multiple emails can be provided e.g. `user=abc@def.com&user=another_user@def.com`.

parameters.name: user_type
parameters.description: Type of user - `User` or `Service`. `User` returns data for authenticated Cloudsmith users in your workspace. `Service` returns data for service accounts.

get.description: API to provide usage data derived from client logs as single aggregated values. Available for _Member_, _Manager_ and _Owner_ level Users. All times in UTC.

parameters.name: aggregate
parameters.description:
Type of aggregation.

* `BYTES_DOWNLOADED_AVG` - bytes_downloaded_avg
* `BYTES_DOWNLOADED_SUM` - bytes_downloaded_sum
* `IP_ADDRESS_COUNT_UNIQUE` - ip_address_count_unique
* `REQUEST_COUNT` - request_count
* `TIME_TAKEN_AVG` - time_taken_avg
* `TIME_TAKEN_MAX` - time_taken_max
* `TIME_TAKEN_P50` - time_taken_p50
* `TIME_TAKEN_P75` - time_taken_p75
* `TIME_TAKEN_P90` - time_taken_p90
* `TIME_TAKEN_P95` - time_taken_p95
* `TIME_TAKEN_P99` - time_taken_p99
* `TIME_TAKEN_SUM` - time_taken_sum

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: End of the time range to filter logs. End time is exclusive, i.e. an end time of `2025-01-01` results in a query that returns logs with a timestamp of _before_ `2025-01-01T00:00:00`.

parameters.name: entitlement_token
parameters.description: Unique identifier to grant access to a specific software package or repository. Accepted values are the token name, token unique identifier or the token itself.

parameters.name: group_by

items.description:
* `REPOSITORY` - Repository
* `USER` - User
* `ENTITLEMENT_TOKEN` - Entitlement Token
* `PACKAGE_FORMAT` - Package Format
* `IP_ADDRESS` - IP Address
* `PACKAGE` - Package

* `BYTES_DOWNLOADED_SUM` - bytes_downloaded_sum

parameters.description:
Type of interval over which to perform the specified aggregation.

* `MINUTE` - Minute

* `DAY` - Day
* `WEEK` - Week
* `MONTH` - Month
* `YEAR` - Year
* `FIVE_MINUTES` - 5 Minutes
* `FIFTEEN_MINUTES` - 15 Minutes

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: A search string to limit results by name. Legal fields are: `name`. Boolean operators may be used to construct intricate queries. Omitting boolean operators is interpreted as an implicit `AND`.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: A comma-separated string of fields to sort by. Legal fields are: `created_at`, `name`, `version`, `updated_at`. Descending order can be expressed by prepending `-` to a field name.

MaxPoliciesReached.description: Occurs when the number of repositories associated with a workspace is already at the maximum.

get.description: List all actions for the policy.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

post.description: Create an action for a policy.

MaxActionsReached.description: Occurs when the number of actions associated with a policy is already at the maximum.

get.description: Retrieve an action for a policy.

put.description: Update an action for a policy.

patch.description: Partially update an action for a policy.

delete.description: Delete an action for a policy.

get.description:
Simulates the execution of a Policy to verify its behavior without taking any actions.

This endpoint evaluates all packages in the organization, generating a "decision log" for each evaluation.
Each log contains:
- Package metadata provided to the policy engine at runtime.
- Output from the user-defined Rego policy.

No actions associated with the policy are executed. Instead, the endpoint reports what would happen to each package if the policy were active.

parameters.name: package_query_string
parameters.description: A [package search](https://help.cloudsmith.io/docs/search-packages) query by which to filter the packages being evaluated.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: correlation_id
parameters.description: Filter by `correlation_id`.

parameters.name: ended_after
parameters.description: Filter by `ended_at`. This operates as an inclusive lower bound (greater than or equal to).

parameters.name: ended_before
parameters.description: Filter by `ended_at`. This operates as an exclusive upper bound (less than).

parameters.name: match
parameters.description: Filter by whether the policy matched the package.

parameters.name: package
parameters.description: Filter by package identifier (`slug_perm`).

parameters.name: package_format
parameters.description: Filter by package format.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: policy
parameters.description: Filter by  policy identifier (`slug_perm`).

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: Filter by repository identifier (`slug_perm`).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: A comma-separated string of fields to sort by. Legal fields are: `started_at`, `ended_at`. Descending order can be expressed by prepending `-` to a field name.

parameters.name: started_after
parameters.description: Filter by `started_at`. This operates as an inclusive lower bound (greater than or equal to).

parameters.name: started_before
parameters.description: Filter by `started_at`. This operates as an exclusive upper bound (less than).

precedence.description: The order in which this action occurs relative to other actions for the same policy.

created_at.description: The date and time the policy was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time the policy was updated.

name.description: A descriptive name for the repository.

slug.description: The slug identifies the repository in URIs.

slug_perm.description: The slug_perm immutably identifies the repository. It will never change once a repository has been created.

repository_type.description:
Repository type - `Public`, `Private` or `Open Source`.

* `PUBLIC` - Public
* `PRIVATE` - Private
* `OPEN_SOURCE` - Open-Source

edge.description: Edge location and cache hit information.

request.description: Information about the original request - authentication method, downloaded bytes, user agent etc.

* `NONE` - none
* `TOKEN` - token
* `SIGNED` - signed
* `BASIC_API_KEY` - basic_api_key
* `BASIC_TOKEN` - basic_token

method.description:
Request HTTP method.

* `UNKNOWN` - Unknown
* `DELETE` - DELETE
* `GET` - GET
* `HEAD` - HEAD
* `OPTIONS` - OPTIONS
* `PATCH` - PATCH
* `POST` - POST
* `PUT` - PUT

MethodEnum.description:
* `UNKNOWN` - Unknown
* `DELETE` - DELETE
* `GET` - GET
* `HEAD` - HEAD
* `OPTIONS` - OPTIONS
* `PATCH` - PATCH
* `POST` - POST
* `PUT` - PUT

filters.description: Filters applied to the metrics response

MetricsResponseDimensions.description:
Dimensions show result-specific groupings for a result/series.

Only includes those which are more specific than the overall filters (i.e.
anything grouped by).

aggregate.description:
Aggregate to apply to metrics.

* `BYTES_DOWNLOADED_AVG` - bytes_downloaded_avg
* `BYTES_DOWNLOADED_SUM` - bytes_downloaded_sum
* `IP_ADDRESS_COUNT_UNIQUE` - ip_address_count_unique
* `REQUEST_COUNT` - request_count
* `TIME_TAKEN_AVG` - time_taken_avg
* `TIME_TAKEN_MAX` - time_taken_max
* `TIME_TAKEN_P50` - time_taken_p50
* `TIME_TAKEN_P75` - time_taken_p75
* `TIME_TAKEN_P90` - time_taken_p90
* `TIME_TAKEN_P95` - time_taken_p95
* `TIME_TAKEN_P99` - time_taken_p99
* `TIME_TAKEN_SUM` - time_taken_sum

package_format.description:
Group by Package Format.

* `DEB` - Debian
* `RPM` - RedHat
* `RUBY` - Ruby
* `PYTHON` - Python
* `MAVEN` - Maven
* `BOWER` - Bower
* `DOCKER` - Docker
* `RAW` - Raw
* `CHOCOLATEY` - Chocolatey

MetricsResponseParams.description:
Serializer for input parameters used in a Metrics API query.

This serializer ensures that the query parameters are included in the API response, allowing clients to see the exact
parameters used for generating metrics.

start_time.description: Start of the time range for which to filter logs. Start time is inclusive, i.e. a `start_time` of `2025-01-01` results in a query that returns logs with a timestamp greater than or equal to 2025-01-01T00:00:00.

end_time.description: End of the time range for which to filter logs. End time is exclusive, i.e. an `end_time` of `2025-01-01` results in a query that returns logs with a timestamp of less than 2025-01-01T00:00:00.

package.description: Package slug or package unique identifier by which to filter logs.

aggregate.description:
Aggregation used.

* `BYTES_DOWNLOADED_AVG` - bytes_downloaded_avg
* `BYTES_DOWNLOADED_SUM` - bytes_downloaded_sum
* `IP_ADDRESS_COUNT_UNIQUE` - ip_address_count_unique
* `REQUEST_COUNT` - request_count
* `TIME_TAKEN_AVG` - time_taken_avg
* `TIME_TAKEN_MAX` - time_taken_max
* `TIME_TAKEN_P50` - time_taken_p50
* `TIME_TAKEN_P75` - time_taken_p75
* `TIME_TAKEN_P90` - time_taken_p90
* `TIME_TAKEN_P95` - time_taken_p95
* `TIME_TAKEN_P99` - time_taken_p99
* `TIME_TAKEN_SUM` - time_taken_sum

interval.description:
Time interval over which to aggregate.

* `MINUTE` - Minute
* `HOUR` - Hour
* `DAY` - Day
* `WEEK` - Week
* `MONTH` - Month
* `YEAR` - Year
* `FIVE_MINUTES` - 5 Minutes
* `FIFTEEN_MINUTES` - 15 Minutes

group_by.description: Field(s) to group the metrics by.

dimensions.description: Dimensions of the metrics response. Aggregate used, aggregate unit, groupings applied etc.

values.description: A list of values for the requested aggregate. This will be returned when a time-series response is requested using the `interval` parameter.

value.description: A single value for the requested aggregate. This will be returned when the response is not in time-series format (ie. no `interval` is requested).

PackageStateEnum.description:
* `AVAILABLE` - The package is available for download.
* `BLOCKED` - The package is not downloadable.
* `DELETED` - The package is deleted.
* `QUARANTINED` - The package is quarantined.

precedence.description: The order in which this action occurs relative to other actions for the same policy.

created_at.description: The date and time the policy was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time the policy was updated.

created_at.description: The date and time the policy was created.

rego.description: The rego code which constitutes the Policy logic.

enabled.description: If true, the policy is enabled.

is_terminal.description: If true and the policy matches, no further policies are evaluated.

updated_at.description: The date and time the policy was updated.

version.description: The version of the rego code.

precedence.description: The order in which this policy is evaluated relative to other policies.

rego.description: The rego code which constitutes the Policy logic.

enabled.description: If true, the policy is enabled.

is_terminal.description: If true and the policy matches, no further policies are evaluated.

version.description: The version of the rego code.

PolicyAdvisory.description: An Advisory is all the known information about a vulnerability.

epss.description: The EPSS details. Null if not available.

format.description: The format of the vulnerable package.

package_name.description: The name of the vulnerable package.

patched_versions.description: List of patched versions, if available.

severity.description:
The severity level of the vulnerability.

* `LOW` - LOW
* `MEDIUM` - MEDIUM
* `HIGH` - HIGH
* `CRITICAL` - CRITICAL

PolicyAdvisoryCvss.description: A CVSS score and vector string.

score.description: The EPSS score. Null if not available.

percentile.description: The EPSS percentile. Null if not available.

PolicyArchitecture.description: Serializer for a package architecture for policy purposes.

PolicyDistribution.description: Serializer for a distribution for policy purposes.

PolicyDistributionVersion.description: Serializer for a distribution version for policy purposes.

name.description: The textual name for this version.

PolicyPackage.description: Serializer for packages for policy purposes.

description.description: A textual description of this package.

epoch.description: The epoch of the package version (if any).

release.description: The release of the package version (if any).

security_scan_status_updated_at.description: The datetime the security scanning status was updated.

security_scan_started_at.description: The datetime the security scanning was started.

security_scan_completed_at.description: The datetime the security scanning was completed.

size.description: The calculated size of the package.

slug.description: The public unique identifier for the package.

summary.description: A one-liner synopsis of this package.

uploaded_at.description: The date this package was uploaded.

version.description: The raw version for this package.

PolicyPackageFile.description: Serializer for package files for policy purposes.

size.description: The calculated size of the file.

tag.description: Freeform descriptor that describes what the file is.

PolicyRepository.description: Serializer for the Repository model for policy purposes.

description.description: A description of the repository's purpose/contents.

name.description: A descriptive name for the repository.

slug.description: The slug identifies the repository in URIs.

slug_perm.description: The slug_perm immutably identifies the repository. It will never change once a repository has been created.

PolicyUploader.description: Serializer for packager uploader for policy puposes.

email.title: Email address
email.description: Your email address that we use to contact you. This is only visible to you.

active.description: If selected this is the active key for this repository.

default.description: If selected this is the default key for this repository.

fingerprint.description: The long identifier used by ECDSA for this key.

public_key.description: The public key given to repository users.

ssh_fingerprint.description: The SSH fingerprint used by ECDSA for this key.

active.description: If selected this is the active key for this repository.

default.description: If selected this is the default key for this repository.

fingerprint.description: The long identifier used by GPG for this key.

public_key.description: The public key given to repository users.

SecurityScanStatusEnum.description:
* `AWAITING_SCAN` - Awaiting Security Scan
* `SCANNING` - Security Scanning in Progress
* `VULNERABLE` - Scan Detected Vulnerabilities
* `NOT_VULNERABLE` - Scan Detected No Vulnerabilities
* `DISABLED` - Security Scanning Disabled
* `FAILED` - Security Scanning Failed
* `SKIPPED` - Security Scanning Skipped
* `UNSUPPORTED_PACKAGE` - Security Scanning Not Supported
* `UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT` - Security Scanning Not Supported

precedence.description: The order in which this action occurs relative to other actions for the same policy.

created_at.description: The date and time the policy was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time the policy was updated.
